Audio Description: This British poster in red and black letters set against a white background. All held within a decorative black border of stylized waves, featuring anchors, compasses and other nautical imagery  with the words:  "COME THEN LET US US TO THE TASK TO THE BATTLE & THE TOIL  Each to Our Part  Each to Our Station, Fill the Armies, Rule the Air, Pour out the Munitions, Strangle the U-boats, Sweep the Mines, Plough the Land, Build the Ships, Guard the Streets, Succor the Wounded, Uplift the Downcast & Honour the Brave.  Let us go forward together in all parts of the Empire, in all parts of this Island.  There is not a week, nor a day, nor an hour to be lost.  Mr. Winston Churchill, Prime Minister.     Manchester, 29th January, 1940
Description: Poster, 49.5 x 75 cm, contains lines from the text of an address delivered on January 27, 1940 by Prime Minister Winston Churchill at the Free Trade Hall, Manchester, England.
Rights: Materials in this collection are made available by the Illinois State Library. To request reproductions or inquire about permissions, contact:  islimg@ilsos.net. Please cite the item title and collection name.

Title: Come then let us to the task...
